title: How to Make Nutella Frosted Cupcakes

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 325ºF.
steps.description: Line 12 muffin tins with paper liners to prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Cream together the butter and sugar.
steps.description: Continue creaming until the mixture becomes light; this will take about 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Add in eggs one at a time.
steps.description: Add until fully incorporated. The mixture might not look smooth but that is just fine.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla.
steps.description: Stir in the flour, salt and baking powder until the batter is uniform and no flour remains.

steps.headline: Use an ice cream scoop to fill each muffin liner with batter.
steps.description: The liner should be three quarters full, if you're not using a scoop. Top each cake with 1 1/2 teaspoons Nutella.

steps.headline: Swirl Nutella in with a toothpick, making sure to fold a bit of batter up over the Nutella.
Remove to a wire rack to cool completely.
Finish off with a dollop of Nutella.

text: Preheat oven to 325ºF. Line 12 muffin tins with paper liners to prevent sticking. Cream together the butter and sugar. Continue creaming until the mixture becomes light; this will take about 2 minutes. Add in eggs one at a time. Add until fully incorporated. The mixture might not look smooth but that is just fine. Add the vanilla. Stir in the flour, salt and baking powder until the batter is uniform and no flour remains. Use an ice cream scoop to fill each muffin liner with batter. The liner should be three quarters full, if you're not using a scoop. Top each cake with 1 1/2 teaspoons Nutella. Swirl Nutella in with a toothpick, making sure to fold a bit of batter up over the Nutella.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Remove to a wire rack to cool completely.  Finish off with a dollop of Nutella.  Finished.
